body:
There's a problem in your code, and Psalm failed to explain it, which means there's a problem with Psalm as well.

`$firstForm->childNodes` could be `null`, when there's no form in the document: https://3v4l.org/9fn4j

Psalm should have emitted `PossiblyNullPropertyFetch`, like it does here: https://psalm.dev/r/bb8e6f9645

Also we need to annotate `childNodes` as `DomNodeList<DomNode>` instead of just `DomNodeList` in either `CoreGenericClasses.php` or `PropertyMap.php` (whatever works).

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/bb8e6f9645</summary>

```php
<?php

function f(DomNode | null $node): void {
    $node->childNodes;
}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit bca09d7):

ERROR: PossiblyNullPropertyFetch - 4:5 - Cannot get property on possibly null variable $node of type DomNode|null
```
</details>

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/8640a2b869</summary>

```php
<?php

function f(DomNodeList $list): void {
    $list->item(0)->childNodes; // expected: PossiblyNullPropertyFetch
}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit bca09d7):

No issues!
```
</details>

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/8c2b570727</summary>

```php
<?php
function f(DomNode $node): void {
    ff($node->childNodes);
}

function ff(DomNodeList $_list): void {}
```

```
Psalm output (using commit bca09d7):

INFO: MixedArgumentTypeCoercion - 3:8 - Argument 1 of ff expects DomNodeList<DOMNode>, parent type DOMNodeList provided
```
</details>

> `$firstForm->childNodes` could be `null`, when there's no form in the document:
> https://3v4l.org/9fn4j

In that example `$firstForm` is null, not the `childNodes` property itself. In my actual code I loop over forms based on the count so `$forms->item(n)` won't return null:
https://psalm.dev/r/df37251b65

Yet Psalm still says that `$form->childNodes` has a type of `DOMNodeList|null`, which I don't think is correct. It shouldn't ever be null.

> In that example $firstForm is null, not the childNodes property itself. 

And Psalm not reporting that is a problem. 

> In my actual code I loop over forms based on the count so $forms->item(n) won't return null

Psalm doesn't know that: https://psalm.dev/r/aa02a741ed

issue.title: MixedArgumentTypeCoercion when using templates

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
When using classes with template constraints as arguments in other methods there may be a false positive with a MixedArgumentTypeCoercion where the template constraints is ignored.

Possibly related to #5291 

https://psalm.dev/r/552a9ffbd4

issue.title: Fix type of DomElement childNodes property

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

body: There's no longer an ArgumentTypeCoercion error here, closing
